column5: What does it mean when a lake turns over and what actually happens?

you lose the thermocline as the surface temperature water get dispersed though out the depths...then fish will be scattered all through the water column...happens after a big blow for a few days..  Just noticed....edit to add...welcome to the board
This link will tell you everything you need to know about turnover and more.  http://www.waterontheweb.org/under/lakeecology/05_stratification.html

Hmm  From what I've read it's when surface temps get colder then bottom temps causing the water on the bottom to rise to the surface and surface water to sink to the bottom....  So the lake literally "turns over"

thanks for asking, I didn't wanna be the one to do it  welcome aboard. Hope this place helps you find answers to most if not all your questions. both fishing and beyond. lots of wise men (and women here for sure  )
